member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase
member.summary: Interface representation of the system .
member.remarks: Acts as a base class for deriving concrete wrapper classes to implement the application settings feature in Window Forms applications.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Context
member.summary: Gets the application settings context associated with the settings group.
member.returns: A System.Configuration.SettingsContext associated with the settings group.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Properties
member.summary: Gets the collection of settings properties in the wrapper.
member.returns: A System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection containing all the System.Configuration.SettingsProperty objects used in the current wrapper.
member.exception: The associated settings provider could not be found or its instantiation failed.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.PropertyValues
member.summary: Gets a collection of property values.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Providers
member.summary: Gets the collection of application settings providers used by the wrapper.
member.returns: A System.Configuration.SettingsProviderCollection containing all the System.Configuration.SettingsProvider objects used by the settings properties of the current settings wrapper.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings key for the application settings group.
member.returns: A System.String containing the settings key for the current settings group.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the specified application settings property.
member.param: A System.String containing the name of the property to access.
member.returns: If found, the value of the named settings property; otherwise, null.
member.exception: There are no properties associated with the current wrapper or the specified property could not be found.
An attempt was made to set a read-only property.
The value supplied is of a type incompatible with the settings property, during a set operation.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.SettingChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the value of an application settings property is changed.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsLoaded
member.summary: Occurs after the application settings are retrieved from storage.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsSaving
member.summary: Occurs before values are saved to the data store.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.GetPreviousVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the named settings property for the previous version of the same application.
member.param: A System.String containing the name of the settings property whose value is to be returned.
member.returns: An System.Object containing the value of the specified System.Configuration.SettingsProperty if found; otherwise, null.
member.exception: The property does not exist. The property count is zero or the property cannot be found in the data store.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Reload
member.summary: Refreshes the application settings property values from persistent storage.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Reset
member.summary: Restores the persisted application settings values to their corresponding default properties.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Save
member.summary: Stores the current values of the application settings properties.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsBase.Upgrade
member.summary: Updates application settings to reflect a more recent installation of the application.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider
member.summary: Settings provider which stores settings in the HKLM or HKCU registry. Builds the registry path based on the SOFTWARE base key then subkeys of AssemblyCompany, AssemblyProduct and optional RegistrySettingsProviderSubkeyAttribute. e.g. HKLM/HKCU then SOFTWARE\Company\Product\[Subkey\]Setting = Value.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: Name of the application. Returns the AssemblyProduct name.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes the provider with our application name.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.SetPropertyValues(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValueCollection)
member.summary: SetPropertyValue is invoked when ApplicationSettingsBase.Save is called for only the values marked with this provider attribute.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.GetPropertyValues(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
member.summary: Returns the collection of settings property values for the specified application instance and settings property group.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.GetRegKey(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Helper method: fetches correct registry subkey. HKLM is used for settings marked as application-scoped. HKLU is used for settings marked as user-scoped.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.IsUserScoped(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Helper method: walks the "attribute bag" for a given property to determine if it is user-scoped or not. Note that this provider does not enforce other rules, such as - unknown attributes - improper attribute combinations (e.g. both user and app - this implementation would say true for user-scoped regardless of existence of app-scoped)

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProvider.GetSubKeyPath(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Builds the registry path based on the SOFTWARE base key then subkeys of AssemblyCompany, AssemblyProduct and optional RegistrySettingsProviderSubkeyAttribute. Does not include the HKLM or HKCU hive. e.g. SOFTWARE\Company\Product\[Subkey\]Setting = Value.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProviderSubkeyAttribute
member.summary: Attribute which is applied to settings properties in the settings designer class to allow the sub-key(s) to be specified when using the RegistrySettingsProvider.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProviderSubkeyAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Specified the sub-key(s) in which to store this setting.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Configuration.RegistrySettingsProviderSubkeyAttribute.Subkey
member.summary: Sub-Key path in which to store the setting. e.g. "Preferences\Display".

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Data.SqlExtensions
member.summary: Extensions and helper methods for working with SQL.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Data.SqlExtensions.ParameterCache
member.summary: Cache of items for a given command hash-code.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.SqlExtensions.BuildConnectionString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an SQL Server connection string from common pieces, e.g. server name, database, user & password (if not integrated security).
member.param: Database server name or (local) for shared memory local access.
User name or null/empty for Windows integrated security.
Password or null/empty for Windows integrated security.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.SqlExtensions.CreateCommandWithParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a command object for the specified stored procedure, automatically populating the parameters. Parameter sets are cached for performance.
member.param: Connection used to derive parameters (first time only) or create the command.
Name of the stored procedure for which to create the command and parameters.
